Race.SpecificTitle: Justice of the Peace -- Justice of the Peace Ward  4
Constable -- Justice of the Peace Ward  5
PW Parish Council (Vet.) -- Disabled Vet. Homestead Exemp. - PC
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Proposition
(Disabled Veterans Homestead Exemption)

Summary:  Authorizes an additional homestead exemption in the Parish of St. Mary, State of Louisiana, for certain disabled veterans and surviving spouses in accordance with and subject to the provisions of Article VII, Section 21(K) of the Louisiana Constitution.
Race.FullText: Shall an additional homestead exemption be authorized in the Parish of St. Mary, State of Louisiana, for certain disabled veterans and surviving spouses in accordance with and subject to the provisions of Article VII, Section 21(K) of the Louisiana Constitution, provided that this additional homestead exemption shall extend and apply to property in St. Mary Parish only after approval by a majority of the registered voters of St. Mary Parish voting on this proposition?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW Cons. School Dist. #5 -- 11.18 Mills - SB - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Proposition
(Consolidated School District No. 5)
(Tax Renewal)

Summary:  10 year, 11.18 mills tax renewal election for the purpose of giving additional support to public elementary and secondary schools in Consolidated School District No. 5 by providing funds for salary obligations and educational management, advancement and enrichment.
Race.FullText: Shall Consolidated School District No. 5 of the Parish of St. Mary, State of Louisiana (a parishwide school district) (the "District"), be authorized to continue to levy an eleven and eighteen hundredths (11.18) mills tax on all the property subject to taxation in the District (an estimated $6,338,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2012 and ending with the year 2021, for the purpose of giving additional support to public elementary and secondary schools in the District by providing funds for salary obligations and educational management, advancement and enrichment?

Race.SpecificTitle: Water & Sewer Comm. #2 -- 11 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Water and Sewer Commission No. 2 Proposition
(Tax Renewal)

Summary: 10 year, 11 mills tax renewal for the purpose of constructing and acquiring improvements and extensions to the waterworks systems and sewerage systems and related facilities of the Water and Sewer Commission No. 2 and operating and maintaining said systems, a work of public improvement for the Commission.
Race.FullText: Shall the St. Mary Parish Water and Sewer Commission No. 2, State of Louisiana (the "Commission"), be authorized to continue to levy a tax of eleven (11) mills on all property subject to taxation within the jurisdiction and boundaries of the Commission (an estimated $730,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the Tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2012 and ending with the year 2021, for the purpose of constructing and acquiring improvements and extensions to the waterworks systems and sewerage systems and related facilities of the Commission and operating and maintaining said systems, a work of public improvement for the Commission?

Race.SpecificTitle: Rec. Dist. No. 2 Prop. #1 -- 13.34 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Recreation District No. 2 Propositions
Proposition No. 1
(Millage Continuation)

Summary:  10 year, 13.34 mills tax continuation for maintaining, operating and improving recreational facilities in Recreation District No. 2.
Race.FullText: Shall Recreation District No. 2 of the Parish of St. Mary, State of Louisiana (the "District"), continue to levy a thirteen and thirty-four hundredths (13.34) mills tax on all the property subject to taxation in the District (an estimated $1,119,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the Tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2012 and ending with the year 2021, for the purpose of maintaining, operating and improving recreational facilities in the District, said millage to represent a thirty-four hundredths of a mill (.34) increase over the 13 mills tax authorized to be levied through the year 2011 pursuant to an election held on July 20, 2002?

Race.SpecificTitle: Rec. Dist. No. 2 Prop. #2 -- $2,000,000 Bonds - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Recreation District No. 2 Propositions
Proposition No. 2
(Bond)

Summary:  To authorize not exceeding $2,000,000 of not exceeding 10 year General Obligation Bonds for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining or operating parks, playgrounds, recreation centers and other recreational facilities in Recreation District No. 2.
Race.FullText: Shall Recreation District No. 2 of the Parish of St. Mary, State of Louisiana (the "District"), incur debt and issue bonds to the amount of not exceeding Two Million Dollars ($2,000,000), to run not exceeding ten (10) years from date thereof, with interest at a rate or rates not exceeding seven per centum (7%) per annum, for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining or operating parks, playgrounds, recreation centers and other recreational facilities; which bonds will be general obligations of the District and will be payable from ad valorem taxes to be levied and collected in the manner provided by Article VI, Section 33 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974 and statutory authority supplemental thereto, an estimated 3 mills being required to service all general obligation bonds of the District in the first year of issue?
